channel.description: Recent content in Resources on Whitaker Lab

item.title: rOpenSci Fellowship Application 2017
item.description: On this page you can find the answers submitted as my application to the rOpenSci fellowships program in 2017. The application was submitted on September 1st at 10:48pm. (Over nine hours before the deadline üòâ). It was required to fit on a maximum of 3 A4 pages. You can download the PDF here. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation.

item.title: Mozilla Mini Grant application 2017
item.description: This is my application for a Mozilla Mini Grant. The application was submitted on the 1st of June 2017. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation. Mozilla Mini Grant application 1st June 2017 Applicant Details Name: Isla Staden Physical address: Alan Turing Institute

item.title: OpenCon application 2016
item.description: OpenCon is a conference for early career academics and seeks to empower the next generation to advance Open Access, Open Education, and Open Data. These are the essays from my (successful) application to attend OpenCon 2016 in Washington DC. The application was submitted on Monday 11th July 2016. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation.

item.title: Mozilla Fellows for Science Application 2015
item.description: On this page you can find the answers from my (unsuccessful) application to become a Mozilla Fellow for Science in 2015. The application was submitted on August 14th at 7:01pm while on holiday in Edinburgh! I had some delicious cocktails that evening üòä üç∏. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation.

item.title: Mozilla Fellows for Science Application 2016
item.description: On this page you can find the answers from my (successful!) application to become a Mozilla Fellow for Science in 2016. The application was submitted on Jul 15th at 11:33pm (swoosh, just before the deadline). This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License which means you can distribute, remix, tweak, and build upon these answers as long as you credit me for the original creation.
